intro: Agalma delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's agalma, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southwest China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, with prominent stamens. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Agalma delavayi is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
